metadata.title: Live Updates: Church attack leaves 2 dead, 8 injured; suspect killed in shooting

content.text: Savewith a NBCUniversal ProfileCreate your free profile or log in to save this articleUpdated Sept. 28, 2025, 3:30 PM EDT / Source: NBC NewsBy NBC NewsWhat we know:A 40-year-old man drove a vehicle through the front doors of a Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints building today in Grand Blanc, Michigan, before opening fire.At least two people are de and multiple injured, authorities said. The suspect was also killed in the shooting.The suspect, identified as a Burton man, exited the vehicle and began firing rounds at people who were attending Sunday service, police said. The suspect used an assault rifle. Authorities said a fire also broke out at the church and was believed to have been deliberately set by the gunman. The blaze was extinguished within the past hour, but investigators say more victims maybe be found inside.The FBI and the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives (ATF) are responding to the incident, Attorney General Pam Bondi said.ShareSecond person dies from church shootingMarlene LenthangA second person has died in the shooting, police announced. “There has been one more fatality due to gunshots. That person h died at a local hospital,” Grand Blanc Township Police Chief William Renye said in a video shared on Facebook. Locals seeking to reunify with family members at the church can call (248) 705-7352, which will connect callers to the Red Cross who are on site and can locate loved ones. Starting tomorrow through the rest of the week, locals can come into the police department for counseling services, Renye announced.ShareShooting comes hours after death of LDS president The Associated PressToday's dely shooting came just hours after the death of Russell M. Nelson, the oldest-ever president of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, who died yesterday at 101.Nelson died at his home in Salt Lake City, church spokesperson Candice Msen said in a statement.Nelson, a former heart surgeon, spent four deces in the highest levels of church leership after he was selected in 1984 to join a top church governing body called the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles. He ascended to the presidency in January 2018 when Thomas S. Monson died and in 2024 became the first president of the faith to hit the century mark.Re the full story here.ShareOfficials to dress the public at 5 p.m. ETDoha ManiOfficials will host a press conference at 5 p.m. ET regarding the shooting.Both Grand Blanc Township Police Chief Bill Renye and Genesee County Sheriff Chris Swanson are expected to attend the briefing. A press release from Swanson's office ds that they will offer updates on the investigation as well as victim support services. ShareTexas to form task forces to protect houses of worship, governor saysDoha ManiTangni Noriegoha Mani and Tangni NoriegaTexas Gov. Greg Abbott responded to the news of the church attack by saying he will do more to protect places of worship.He wrote in a post on X that he's directed the state's Department of Public Safety to form task forces with local and federal partners on the matter."The escalation of violent attacks against people and places of faith is heinous and must end," Abbott wrote.ShareLDS church releases statement following dely shooting and fireChristiana CorporonMirna AlsharifChristiana Corporon and Mirna AlsharifThe Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints released a statement about today's shooting."The Church is in communication with local law enforcement as the investigation continues and as we receive updates on the condition of those affected," said church spokesperson Doug Andersen. "We offer thanks to the emergency responders who are assisting victims and families."Andersen said the church is "deeply grateful for the outpouring of prayers and concern from so many people around the world." "In moments of sorrow and uncertainty, we find strength and comfort through our faith in Jesus Christ," he said. "Places of worship are meant to be sanctuaries of peacemaking, prayer and connection. We pray for peace and healing for all involved."ShareTrump reacts to church shooting Mirna AlsharifPresident Donald Trump said on Truth Social he was briefed on the shooting."The Trump ministration will keep the Public posted, as we always do. In the meantime, PRAY for the victims, and their families," he wrote in the statement posted to Truth Social. "THIS EPIDEMIC OF VIOLENCE IN OUR COUNTRY MUST END, IMMEDIATELY!" SharePolice believe suspect set fire to church intentionally and more victims are possibleMirna AlsharifPolice believe the suspect who opened fire at the church also intentionally set it on fire. "We are still trying to determine exactly when and where that fire ended up coming from and how it got started, so we believe it was deliberately set out by the suspect," Renye said at this afternoon's briefing.A motive for the fire is still unclear. Renye said he believes there were people near the fire who may have been unable to escape."So, we do believe that we will find ditional victims once we're able to search that, once there's no signs of a fire reigniting," he said. ShareSuspect in church shooting and fire identified as 40-year-old Burton residentMirna AlsharifPolice identified the suspect in the church shooting and fire as a 40-year-old man from Burton.According to Renye, the suspect drove his vehicle into The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints and began firing rounds at the hundreds of people who were attending Sunday service. The suspect used an assault rifle, police said.ShareAt least 1 killed and 9 injured in church shootingMirna AlsharifAt least one person was killed and 9 were injured in today's shooting at The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints in Grand Blanc, Michigan, according to authorities. The suspect was also killed in the shooting, police confirmed. A couple of the remaining victims are in critical condition while the rest are stable, according to Grand Blanc Township Police Chief William Renye.Renye said he expects to find ditional victims now that the fire at the church has been contained. ShareVideo shows massive fire at LDS churchNollaig O'ConnorDrone video from Grand Blanc showed the massive fire at The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints.A large plume of rising black smoke could be seen flanked by orange flames. The fire has since been contained, according to police. ShareFire at church contained Mirna AlsharifJanhvi BhojwaniMirna Alsharif and Janhvi BhojwaniThe fire at The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints is now contained, according to the Grand Blanc Township Police Department. The cause of the fire is not known at this time. "We do not have names of victims at his time," police said. ShareGrand Blanc resident 'completely distraught' by church shooting and fireMirna AlsharifJoe KottkeMirna Alsharif and Joe KottkeJoe Ostrander, 25, a lifelong Grand Blanc resident, was driving to The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints when he heard about the shooting and fire. Massive flames and smoke rise from The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints in Grand Blanc, Mich., on Sunday.Julie J, @Malkowski6April via X / AP"I’ve never heard of anything like this ever happening in my city," Ostrander said.He describes his hometown as "peaceful, quiet, small," and full of mom-and-pop shops. "I’m completely distraught," he said. ShareNYPD and LAPD deploying officers to religious institutions 'out of an abundance of caution'Janhvi BhojwaniMirna AlsharifJanhvi Bhojwani and Mirna AlsharifThe NYPD is deploying officers to religious institutions across the city "out of an abundance of caution" following reports of a shooting and fire at a church in Michigan today.Los Angeles Mayor Karen Bass wrote on X that the city's officers would do the same, increasing patrols around places of worship. "This type of violence is reprehensible and should have no place in our country," Bass wrote. "My heart is with the families impacted and the entire Grand Blanc community."ShareGov. Whitmer: 'Violence anywhere, especially in a place of worship, is unacceptable'Mirna AlsharifJanhvi BhojwaniMirna Alsharif and Janhvi BhojwaniIn a statement, Gov. Gretchen Whitmer said her heart is breaking for the Grand Blanc community, where a shooting and fire at a church has been reported with several victims"Violence anywhere, especially in a place of worship, is unacceptable," Whitmer said in the statement. "I am grateful to the first responders who took action quickly."ShareFBI and ATF responding to church shooting and fireMirna AlsharifJanhvi BhojwaniMirna Alsharif and Janhvi BhojwaniThe FBI and the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives (ATF) are responding to the LDS church where a shooting and fire have resulted in multiple victims, Attorney General Pam Bondi confirmed."Such violence at a place of worship is heartbreaking and chilling," Bondi said in a statement. The FBI will "provide any requested support necessary," FBI Deputy Director Dan Bongino said. ShareGenesee County Sheriff: 'The entire church is on fire'Mirna AlsharifA fire remains active at The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints in Grand Blanc, Michigan, according to Genesee County Sheriff Christopher Swanson."The entire church is on fire," Swanson said in a video update, ding that the area is currently a dynamic scene.Swanson confirmed that people who were at the church have been evacuated and that there are multiple victims. The scene is no longer a threat, he said."Just know that there's a lot of things that are happening that we are not able to communicate, just because of the work that needs to be done," he said. ShareVideo shows a large plume of smoke rising from churchNollaig O'ConnorVideo taken in Genesee County, Michigan, this morning shows a large plume of black smoke rising from the The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints in Grand Blanc.Police said there's an active fire at the church. ShareRep. John James 'horrified' by report of shooting and fire at Michigan churchJanhvi BhojwaniMirna AlsharifJanhvi Bhojwani and Mirna AlsharifRep. John James, R-Mich., said he is "horrified" about reports of a shooting and fire at a Grand Blanc church."On this Sunday, a day meant for worship and peace, such violence is a grave evil," James wrote on X. "Our prayers are with the victims, their families, and the entire community."ShareShooting and fire at Michigan church, police say there are multiple victimsChristiana CorporonMirna AlsharifChristiana Corporon and Mirna AlsharifPolice confirmed this morning that there was a shooting at The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints in Genesee County, Michigan.The church is also actively on fire, according to the Grand Blanc Township Police Department."There are multiple victims and the shooter is down," police said. "There is NO threat to the public at this time."It's not immediately clear whether the shooter is de or in custody.Police encouraged residents to avoid the area. NEW UPDATESNBC NewsNBC News

What we know: A 40-year-old man drove a vehicle through the front doors of a Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints building today in Grand Blanc, Michigan, before opening fire. At least two people are dead and multiple injured, authorities said. The suspect was also killed in the shooting. The suspect, identified as a Burton man, exited the vehicle and began firing rounds at people who were attending Sunday service, police said. The suspect used an assault rifle.  Authorities said a fire also broke out at the church and was believed to have been deliberately set by the gunman. The blaze was extinguished within the past hour, but investigators say more victims maybe be found inside. The FBI and the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives (ATF) are responding to the incident, Attorney General Pam Bondi said."}</script><meta content="Multiple people injured following class="article-body__content"><div class="summary-box" data-testid="summary-box" id="anchor-6262ae"><div class="summary-box__content"><h2 class="summary-box__headline">What we know:</h2><ul class="summary-box__items"><li>A 40-year-old man drove a vehicle through the front doors of a Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints building today in Grand Blanc, Michigan, before opening fire.</li><li>At least two people are dead and multiple injured, authorities said. The suspect was also killed in the shooting.</li><li>The suspect, identified as a Burton man, exited the vehicle and began firing rounds at people who were attending Sunday service, police said. The suspect used an assault rifle. </li><li>Authorities said a fire also broke out at the church and was believed to have been deliberately set by the gunman. The blaze was extinguished within the past hour, but investigators say more victims maybe be found inside.</li><li>The FBI and the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives (ATF) are responding to the incident, Attorney General Pam Bondi said.</li></ul></div></div></div><div class="article-body__content"><div class="LiveBlog relative liveBlogCards" data-testid="live-blog-posts" data-icid="live-blog-card-link" data-testid="chat-card-body-container"><p class="body-graf">A second person has died in the shooting, police announced. </p><p class="body-graf">“There has been one more fatality due to gunshots. That person had died at a local hospital,” Grand Blanc Township Police Chief William Renye said in a video shared on Facebook. </p><p class="body-graf">Locals seeking to reunify with family members at the church can call (248) 705-7352, which will connect callers to the Red Cross who are on site and can locate loved ones. </p><p class="body-graf">Starting tomorrow through the rest of the week, locals can come into the police department for counseling services, Renye announced.</p><div class="styles_hidden-show-more-content__FOVN1 dn" data-testid="chat-card-body-container"><p class="body-graf">Today's deadly shooting came just hours after the death of Russell M. Nelson, the oldest-ever president of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, who died yesterday at 101.</p><p class="body-graf">Nelson died at his home in Salt Lake City, church spokesperson Candice Madsen said in a statement.</p><p class="body-graf">Nelson, a former heart surgeon, spent four decades in the highest levels of church leadership after he was selected in 1984 to join a top church governing body called the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles. He <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/93-year-old-ex-surgeon-appointed-head-mormon-church-n838096" target="_blank">ascended to the presidency</a> in January 2018 when Thomas S. Monson died and in 2024 became the first president of the faith to hit the century mark.</p><p class="body-graf"><a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/russell-m-nelson-oldest-ever-president-church-jesus-christ-latter-day-rcna234197" target="_blank"><strong>Read the full story</strong></a> <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/russell-m-nelson-oldest-ever-president-church-jesus-christ-latter-day-rcna234197" target="_blank"><strong>here</strong></a>.</p><div Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints released a statement about today's shooting.</p><p class="body-graf">"The Church is in communication with local law enforcement as the investigation continues and as we receive updates on the condition of those affected," said church spokesperson Doug Andersen. "We offer thanks to the emergency responders who are assisting victims and families."</p><p class="body-graf">Andersen said the church is "deeply grateful for the outpouring of prayers and concern from so many people around the world." </p><p class="body-graf">"In moments of sorrow and uncertainty, we find strength and comfort through our faith in Jesus Christ," he said. "<a href="https://www.churchofjesuschrist.org/welcome?lang=eng" target="_blank">Places of worship</a> are meant to be sanctuaries of peacemaking, prayer and connection. We pray for peace and healing for all involved."</p><div class="styles_hidden-show-more-content__FOVN1 dn" id="rcrd89504-overflow-content"></div></div></div><div class="styles_chat-blog-card__wNypF data-testid="chat-card-body-container"><p class="body-graf">A fire remains active at The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints in Grand Blanc, Michigan, according to Genesee County Sheriff Christopher Swanson.</p><p class="body-graf">"The entire church is on fire," Swanson said in a video update, adding that the area is currently a dynamic scene.</p><p class="body-graf">Swanson confirmed that people who were at the church have been evacuated and that there are multiple victims. The scene is no longer a threat, he said.</p><p class="body-graf">"Just know that there's a lot of things that are happening that we are not able to communicate, just because of the work that needs to be done," he said. </p><div class="styles_hidden-show-more-content__FOVN1 dn" id="rcrd89492-overflow-content"></div></div></div><div class="ad dn-print ad--text-alignment ad-container boxinlineAd mb8" confirmed this morning that there was a shooting at The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints in Genesee County, Michigan.</p><p class="body-graf">The church is also actively on fire, according to the Grand Blanc Township Police Department.</p><p class="body-graf">"There are multiple victims and the shooter is down," police said. "There is NO threat to the public at this time."</p><p class="body-graf">It's not immediately clear whether the shooter is dead or in custody.</p><p class="body-graf">Police encouraged residents to avoid the area.</p><div class="styles_hidden-show-more-content__FOVN1 dn" id="rcrd89489-overflow-content"></div></div></div></div><div class="liveBlogCards__scrollUpButtonContainer
